intro: Lastrea rioverdensis, commonly known as the Rio Verde Lastrea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture, while its stems are usually square in cross-section. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution.
